track.name: Too Many Nights (feat. Don Toliver & with Future)

wiki.summary: On the outlandish and catchy “Too Many Nights,” Metro Boomin enlists frequent collaborator, Future along with one of his recent new collaborators, Don Toliver, to rap more about the common use of drugs during their “many nights” within their lavish lifestyles surrounded by money, women and spending on high-priced brands. The song simultaneously marks again the joint between Metro and Toliver since his participation in Don Toliver’s sophomore album, Life of a DON, respectively with the songs, “Company Pt. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: On the outlandish and catchy “Too Many Nights,” Metro Boomin enlists frequent collaborator, Future along with one of his recent new collaborators, Don Toliver, to rap more about the common use of drugs during their “many nights” within their lavish lifestyles surrounded by money, women and spending on high-priced brands. The song simultaneously marks again the joint between Metro and Toliver since his participation in Don Toliver’s sophomore album, Life of a DON, respectively with the songs, “Company Pt. 2” and “Swangin On Westheimer” — Furthermore, the two artists would appear twice again with “Around Me,” and later the duo—or the trio in question—collaborate again on the album’s cut, “I Can’t Save You (Interlude)”. “Too Many Nights” debuted at #22 on the Billboard Hot 100 during the chart week ending of December 17, 2022. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
